qas.question: Which book did Feynman demand to be listed in?
What did Feynman believe that the Jewish people were?
What religious affiliation did Feynman seek to eliminate?
What religion did Feynman's atheist parents follow?

context: Although born to and raised by parents who were Ashkenazi, Feynman was not only an <a3_0><b8_0>atheist<b8_0/><a3_0/>, but declined to be labelled <a0_0><b5_0><b9_0>Jewish<b9_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/>. He routinely refused to be included in lists or books that classified people by <a4_0>race<a4_0/>. He asked to not be included in Tina Levitan's <a1_0><b6_0>The Laureates: Jewish Winners of the Nobel Prize<b6_0/><a1_0/>, writing, "To select, for approbation the peculiar elements that come from some supposedly Jewish heredity is to open the door to all kinds of nonsense on racial theory," and adding "... at thirteen I was not only converted to other religious views, but I also stopped believing that the Jewish people are in any way '<a2_0><b7_0>the chosen people<b7_0/><a2_0/>'."
